intro: Hieracium chlorophyton subsp. huljakianum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–50 cm, with bright yellow ray florets and a dense, tufted crown of leaves. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Its botanical features make it an important component of high-altitude ecosystems.
